summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center's Daily Lieutenant's Log for August 10, 2019, detailing routine operations and the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein, who was found unresponsive in his cell and transported to a hospital.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate (Reg #76318-054) who was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 in Unit 9 South, leading to a medical emergency, CPR, and transport to a local hospital.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The lieutenant who assumed duties as the Morning Watch Operations Lieutenant and was on duty when the medical emergency for inmate Epstein was announced.

persons.name: Lt.
persons.context: The lieutenant who was relieved of duty at approximately 5:30am by the incoming lieutenant.

connections.description: The lieutenant was the supervising corrections officer on duty when Epstein was found unresponsive and the medical emergency was declared.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) who was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 in Unit 9 South. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital with CPR continuing.

events.title: Inmate Counts and Log Entries
events.description: Routine institutional counts were conducted and announced as clear at 12:49 AM, 3:24 AM, and 5:30 AM. The log also notes standard operations like PREA announcements, equipment checks, and body alarm testing.

events.title: Previous Day's Log Entries
events.description: The log includes entries from the previous day (August 9, 2019), detailing the beginning count, fire system issues, and routine operations.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Reg #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220, Unit 9 South) at 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was initiated immediately and continued by EMTs during transport to a local hospital via ambulance.
The log documents a change in the inmate count from 758 to 757 following Epstein's transport to the hospital.
The document is an official correctional facility log, providing a chronological record of the events surrounding Epstein's medical emergency.
The log notes that the PREA announcement system was malfunctioning on the evening of August 9th and morning of August 10th.
